Browse the source code of netbsd/external/lgpl3/gmp/dist/mpz/realloc.c

1/* _mpz_realloc -- make the mpz_t have NEW_ALLOC digits allocated.
2
3Copyright 1991, 1993-1995, 2000, 2001, 2008 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
4
5This file is part of the GNU MP Library.
6
7The GNU MP Library is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify
8it under the terms of either:
9
10 * the GNU Lesser General Public License as published by the Free
11 Software Foundation; either version 3 of the License, or (at your
12 option) any later version.
13
14or
15
16 * the GNU General Public License as published by the Free Software
17 Foundation; either version 2 of the License, or (at your option) any
18 later version.
19
20or both in parallel, as here.
21
22The GNU MP Library is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but
23WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY
24or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU General Public License
25for more details.
26
27You should have received copies of the GNU General Public License and the
28GNU Lesser General Public License along with the GNU MP Library. If not,
29see https://www.gnu.org/licenses/. */
30
31#include <stdlib.h>
32#include <stdio.h>
33#include "gmp.h"
34#include "gmp-impl.h"
35
36void *
37_mpz_realloc (mpz_ptr m, mp_size_t new_alloc)
38{
39 mp_ptr mp;
40
41 /* Never allocate zero space. */
42 new_alloc = MAX (new_alloc, 1);
43
44 if (sizeof (mp_size_t) == sizeof (int))
45 {
46 if (UNLIKELY (new_alloc > ULONG_MAX / GMP_NUMB_BITS))
47 {
48 fprintf (stderr, "gmp: overflow in mpz type\n");
49 abort ();
50 }
51 }
52 else
53 {
54 if (UNLIKELY (new_alloc > INT_MAX))
55 {
56 fprintf (stderr, "gmp: overflow in mpz type\n");
57 abort ();
58 }
59 }
60
61 mp = __GMP_REALLOCATE_FUNC_LIMBS (PTR(m), ALLOC(m), new_alloc);
62 PTR(m) = mp;
63 ALLOC(m) = new_alloc;
64
65 /* Don't create an invalid number; if the current value doesn't fit after
66 reallocation, clear it to 0. */
67 if (ABSIZ(m) > new_alloc)
68 SIZ(m) = 0;
69
70 return (void *) mp;
71}
72
